condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.3: The birth registration system has strengthened capacity to scale up the registration of children under age 5 years, with focus on children under 1 year of age.

description.narrative: Child Protection continued to apply globally recognized good practices to achieve increased birth registration results by investing available resources in improved access by imploring village scribes, health workers and outreach mobile teams to provide services at the urban health facilities and in very rural and hard to reach communities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of MoUs (state) to avoid dual registration and clarify mandates for birth registration signed between the NPopC-LGA Chairman
Percentage of districts that have a free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration (in accordance with national legal requirements)
Country has an interoperable service delivery with Health
Number of health facilities with trained health workers providing birth registration services
